metaData.description: Accommodation in a restored heritage house from the Historic Center. Hiking or bike trails along the roman galleries, gold mining areas, heritage buildings, mountains, lakes. Rent bikes or guided tours. At the end of the day read a book from our library in the hammock. Rosia Montana, Alba, Apuseni Mountains, Transylvania, Romania.

sections.text: Things to do in Rosia Montana

specificArticles.textContent:
1. Discover an 'unique cultural landscape' - visit Rosia Montana protected area
The remains of the gold mining that started since antiquity (galleries, stamp mills, artificial lakes) and the historic center with the heritage buildings made by the civilizations who came here to extract gold (schools in different languages, multicultural churches or the goldsmith houses) can be visited through the following trails:

2. Visit our natural attractions - great cycling breaks
The surroundings are also amazing, unpaved roads and footpaths bind us to the villages, mountain peaks, lakes and other objectives of the Apuseni Mountains (Carpathians - Transylvania). See the bellow trails that are excellent for bikes (you can rent one from Rosia).

3. See the impact of opening a new open pit mine and visit the existing ones
Huge street protests were made in 2013 against opening a new gold mine by a canadian company. Visit the village which should have been covered by a cyanide lake - 'Corna' trail and ones of the biggest open pit mines from Europe made during communism: Roșia Poieni - 'Geamăna' trail and Cetate - 'Cârnic' trail.
